Articles.Content:
Well, since everyone is doing it these days, I thought I might as well make my own Mun landing video.

This is what I mean when I say I do my braking burn at 3km.

http://youtu.be/L7VIJW315jw

That's it, I don't wanna play anymore.

Ok, calm down Jeb, I was kidding! Seriously, holy wow, what a landing! How can you even do that? I've yet to do my first landing without tipping over...

I guess you play with a joystick?
I do use a joystick, but only for throttle. I use the keyboard for attitude control.
nice little lander you've got yourself there. very nice indeed

I use the keyboard for attitude control.

Oh.

That's embarassing for me... ok then, I'm off for 3 days or so of intense landing training.

Oh.

That's embarassing for me... ok then, I'm off for 3 days or so of intense landing training.

I'm rendering a Munar Descent Tutorial right now. Check it out in the How-To when it's done.
Teach me, master!
I love your style, I love your design, I love your choice of music (and movie you got it from is in my top 3 movies ever). Sorry Superman, I got myself a new hero!
Wow, impressive! NASA should hire you immediately!
Great flying!

Wow, impressive, you got some skill there.

I usually would hate that type of music too, but it worked well in your video.

Reminds me of 70's movie music though. lol

Very professional.

Nice short video too, not like some of those 15 minute monstrosities made by people who love hearing themselves talk.
+1 for Das Boot music!
That is very impressive! I have yet to land a three man command module on the mun but that just gave me a motive to try even harder!
Hot dayum. I usually try to come in at like, .1 or so meters per second but I come in from a million miles in the sky! Nice job!
pretty nice unless you consider that the 2nd to last stage butchered the fuel bug pretty badly. however, even with unlimited fuel, that stunt requires skillz

Is that... is the music from the Das Boot soundtrack? I love that film!#

Wow, impressive! NASA should hire you immediately!

I think NASA like safe, not stylish

Edited August 25, 2012 by BurningSky93

pretty nice unless you consider that the 2nd to last stage butchered the fuel bug pretty badly.

I'm using the fuel bug fix. I mentioned it in the video description.
Nicely done..

pretty nice unless you consider that the 2nd to last stage butchered the fuel bug pretty badly.

As responded to, the 2/3rds thrust was not to exploit the fuel bug. Rather, I speculate, to allow control of the descent if needed. If you aim to land on a spot using full thrust, what do you do if it looks like your going to over-shoot? Using less than full thrust gives you some room for more breaking if needed.
